page.title: 04THE RIVER EXE
page.content:
The river in this stretch is used for recreation. Fishermen regularly fish for trout and salmon. Due to pollution fewer fish are now caught. The flow conditions make it suitable for canoeing; several races take place annually. In September the river hosts a home-made raft race, a very popular event. The Exe in flood is a different picture from the peaceful scene with the much photographed arched granite bridge. Flooding has been eased by prevention schemes and flow control upstream. The river occasionally rises 2.5m above normal level. The bridge is the main traffic crossing on the Exe between Tiverton and Exeter. There are two foot bridges to the south.
Mrs Wendy Baker
